channel.title: Newb Question -- about item giving
channel.description:
ok i got skill capes working now
what i want to happen is when some one gets 99 str it gies tem the str skill cape how do i get it to do that? pls help!

item.title: Newb Question -- about item giving
item.dc:creator: @zammy1 zammy!!
item.description:
@zammy1 wrote:

[quote=“zilchuary, post:9, topic:142416”][quote author=i0wnuall link=topic=194859.msg1750600#msg1750600 date=1189575367]
yeah instead of give item its
addItem(ITEMID, AMOUNT);
[/quote]

hahaha!
no way dude that would give u a skillcape every time u level up on that skill
heres what you need -.-

case 0: // Attack levelup //sendFrame164(6247); //sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248); //sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 6249); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level."); } else if playerlevel = 99; Sendmessage ("Gratz on 99 str!"); Additem("ITEMHERE,1"); } [/quote]
LOL that wouldnt even work! hahahaha pls dont post if you dont kno w what ur talking about.

Read full topic

item.title: Newb Question -- about item giving
item.dc:creator: @zilchuary zilchuary
item.description:
@zilchuary wrote:

[quote=“nd w0t, post:10, topic:142416”]Uhhm,

else if playerlevel = 99;
Sendmessage (“Gratz on 99 str!”);
Additem(“ITEMHERE,1”);
}

HAHAHA! wrong?..
playerlevel - Cannot find symbol, didn’t even test…
Sendmessage - Cannot find symbol…
Additem - Cannot find symbol. Owned?..
Using what he said, which might be wrong? But…

else if (playerLevel[X] = 99);
sendMessage("Gratz on 99 str!");
addItem("YYYY,A");
}

Conclusion?:
YYYY = Item ID
A = Amount
X = SkillLevel… Which for example…
0 = Attack
1 = Defence
2 = Strength
3 = HP
4 = Range
5 = Prayer
6 = Magic
And so on…[/quote]

Please do not spam… i have already posted that…

Read full topic

item.title: Newb Question -- about item giving
item.dc:creator: @nd_w0t nd w0t
item.description:
@nd_w0t wrote:

Uhhm,

else if playerlevel = 99; Sendmessage ("Gratz on 99 str!"); Additem("ITEMHERE,1"); }
HAHAHA! wrong?... playerlevel - Cannot find symbol, didn't even test... Sendmessage - Cannot find symbol.. Additem - Cannot find symbol. Owned?.. Using what he said, which might be wrong? But.. [code] else if (playerLevel[X] = 99); sendMessage("Gratz on 99 str!"); addItem("YYYY,A"); } [/code] Conclusion?: YYYY = Item ID A = Amount X = SkillLevel.. Which for example.. 0 = Attack 1 = Defence 2 = Strength 3 = HP 4 = Range 5 = Prayer 6 = Magic And so on...

Read full topic

item.title: Newb Question -- about item giving

item.description:
@zilchuary wrote:

[quote=“i0wnuall, post:4, topic:142416”]yeah instead of give item its
addItem(ITEMID, AMOUNT);[/quote]

hahaha!
no way dude that would give u a skillcape every time u level up on that skill
heres what you need -.-

case 0: // Attack levelup //sendFrame164(6247); //sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248); //sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 6249); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level."); } else if playerlevel = 99; Sendmessage ("Gratz on 99 str!"); Additem("ITEMHERE,1"); }

item.title: Newb Question -- about item giving
item.dc:creator: @nd_w0t nd w0t
item.description:
@nd_w0t wrote:

…? lol
Idk but try sumit like.
if (PlayerLevel[2] >= 99);
addItem(10708, 1);

Might work, but then again im probbz wrong, you might have to rephrase some of it, but thats looking along the right lines…

item.title: Newb Question -- about item giving
item.dc:creator: @jessemills1 jessemills1
item.description:
@jessemills1 wrote:

doesent work i put in
and i get this error

client.java:3812: not a statement
        ifPlayerskill[2]{skill level} > = 99) addItem(10708,1);
                     ^
client.java:3812: ';' expected
        ifPlayerskill[2]{skill level} > = 99) addItem(10708,1);
                        ^
client.java:3812: ';' expected
        ifPlayerskill[2]{skill level} > = 99) addItem(10708,1);
                                    ^
client.java:3812: illegal start of expression
        ifPlayerskill[2]{skill level} > = 99) addItem(10708,1);
                                      ^
client.java:3812: illegal start of expression
        ifPlayerskill[2]{skill level} > = 99) addItem(10708,1);
                                        ^
client.java:3812: ';' expected
        ifPlayerskill[2]{skill level} > = 99) addItem(10708,1);
                                            ^
6 errors

item.dc:creator: @Paulthegoat2 Paulthegoat2
item.description:
@Paulthegoat2 wrote:

[quote=“i0wnuall, post:2, topic:142416”]look up somthing like this: case 1: // Strength //sendFrame164(6206); //sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced a strength level!", 6207); //sendFrame126("Your strength level is now "+playerLevel[2]+" .", 6208); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced a strength level."); //NpcDialogueSend = true; break;[/quote]

yes and you add something like ifPlayerskill[Skill Number]{skill level} > = 99 give item blah blah

I don’t know the exact code but I’m sure you can find it somewhere in your client or someone elses.
